page.title: 20A POLICE VISIT
page.content: There has also been a great increase in glue sniffing between 15 and 16 year olds in Carmarthen. The two constables were then asked what was the most important thing for the police in 1985 in Carmarthen. One of the most important things was that they have started a better liaison programme between schools. The idea behind this is that the policemen will get to know the individual schools better so that the police will not seem remote to the children. They also said that in 1985 there had been a shortage of manpower.This was partly due to the miners' strike, when many policemen had to go to the coal mining areas.The shortage was also due to the local authority cuts. By Karen Beardmore,Adrian Gomer,Paul Rainbow,Nicola Parry & Stefan Webster.
